intro: Neobaumannia hedyotoidea var. longipila, commonly known as the long-stemmed hedyotoideae, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and trifoliate leaves with elliptical leaflets. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
